description:
From Middle English irkesome, irksum, equivalent to irk +‎ -some, or perhaps continuing (in altered form)
Old English weorcsum (“painful, hurtful”).

adjectives.description: irksome (comparative more irksome, superlative most irksome)

entries.meaning: Marked by irritation or annoyance; disagreeable; troublesome by reason of long continuance or repetition
examples: Synonyms: bothersome, annoying, irritating, wearisome, tedious
He has this irksome habit of racing up to red lights, so he has to brake heavily.
